data.expected: GT x GT -> 1/4 GG, 1/2 GT, 1/4 TT
data.sampled:
The distribution of phenotypes in the offspring of this polymorphic population is:
BG x BG -> 1/4 BB, 1/2 GG
BB x BB -> 1/4 B_, 1/2 BB
B_ x B_ -> 1/2 BB, 1/2 B_

There are 9 possible genotypes (assuming all combinations of the 3 alleles are equally likely).
BG x BG - BB or B, B or GG - (2*4)/2 or (1*4)/2 = 1.
GG x GG - BG or B, B or GG - (BG)/2 = (2*BG)/(2*BG) = 1.
B_ x B_ - BG, B or GG - (BG)/(BG)/2 = (GG)/(BG)/2 = 1.
BG x GG - B or GG, B or BB, B or BBB - (BG)/2 = (BG)/(GG)/2 = 1.

prompt.content:
One type of beetle has 3 possible wing colors, blue, green and turquoise. Randomly caught individuals of a polymorphic population were crossed with each other.
It is a monohybrid inheritance with three alleles, B, G & T. Dominance: B > G > T
You get the parent phenotype, and the distribution of phenotypes in the F1 - generation. State the genotypes of the parents and offspring as accurately as possible. No further explanation necessary. If a given distribution is impossible, state 'impossible'.
Example task:
Blue x Blue -> 4/4 Blue
Example solution:
BB x B_ -> 4/4 B_
Example Task:
Blue x Blue -> 3/4 Blue 1/4 Green
Example Solution:
BG x BG -> 1/4 BB, 1/2 BG, 1/4 GG

options: GT x GT -> 1/4 GG, 1/2 GT, 1/4 TT
